name: Ogilby's Road Map: London to Carlisle via Manchester (1675)
description: Strip road map from John Ogilby's 'Britannia' (1675) â€” the first road atlas of England. Shows the London-Carlisle route through Warrington, Wigan, and Preston, passing near Manchester.
notes:
John Ogilby's Britannia (1675): 100 strip road maps, first printed road atlas of England.
Plate 78: London to Carlisle via Warrington, Newton, Wigan, Preston, Garstang.
Passes through south Lancashire close to Manchester.
102 copper plates + 200 pages of text. 7,500 miles of road surveyed.
Digitized: Internet Archive (1698 edition): https://archive.org/details/bim_early-english-books-1641-1700_britannia-or-the-kingd_ogilby-john_1698
Also: fulltable.com/vts/m/map/ogilby/mna.htm (all plates).
Royal Collection also has a copy.
